values:
You toss me your tips
and look out to the ships
But I'm counting your heads
as I'm making the beds
Cuz there's nobody gonna sleep here, honey
Nobody
NOBODY!

I really really love that song. "Pirate Jenny" from The Threepenny Opera.

So it's really fucking cold. And we turned the heat on. All these old pipes sitting in silence, biding their time until it's that really-fucking-cold time of the year. Creaking in annoyance as they're put to work. Creaking like some sort of old war machine.

War machine? What the fuck. I'm tired. And cold. But.. "nobody gonna sleep here". Overactive imagination...

When I was a kid and it was this time of year, the whole turning on the heat was a horrible, terrible thing. That's when the demons and beastly things would come out of the radiators. We've got these old radiators, you see, and when they come on, they make these creaking whistling shrieking sounds. And I would think some sort of creature was coming out to eat me. And this is still ingrained in my mind when I hear that sound.

So, I'm going to be up all night, listening to all the creaks and cracks and groans coming from all the empty space. Upstairs. In the dark. Where I sleep. Alone. Stupid sounds. Last week I went upstairs and saw that the door to the spare bedroom was halfway out of the doorjamb. Of course my mind went into overdrive. I left the TV on, thinking that IF there was some sort of mass murderer hiding in there (a very bad mass murderer who can't be bothered to tightly shut doors), he or she would be waiting for me to turn the TV off, then wait an adequate amount of time afterwards, then assume I'm asleep and jab me in the neck with a knitting needle. So I left the TV on and read and left the light on. I hate how my mind works sometimes.

The plus side is the smell of the heat. It's oddly comforting. It smells to me like how I'd imagine a grandparent's house would smell. Minues the old people smell. It smells like "home". Heat. If you go to take a hot dish out of the oven, and then smell the oven mitts afterwards, that's what it smells like. Oh, never smelled oven mitts before? Call me crazy.

Back to the whole "Pirate Jenny" thing. Fuck me dead I love this song. So creepy. I'd post the lyrics if they weren't so long. I always like those kind of stories. Someone who seems so small and quiet, people look down on, then BAM it turns out they're psychotic and have just been biding their time to strike.

I've only been able to find the German version of the song, by Lotte Lenya, which is good enough. I've heard Bea Arthur do it, and she's great. God, I'm so gay. I wish I could find Nina Simone's version. Or Ute Lemper.

Lars von Trier was inspired by "Pirate Jenny" to create the Grace character for his America series. A little refresher course for those who don't know: von Trier isn't the biggest fan of America and is making this series about how evil and corrupt we are. Kind of. There's more to it, but that's the basic premise.

The first movie was Dogville, and Nicole Kidman (!) played Grace. She's a fugitive and the kind citizens of Dogville take her in and make her earn her keep. It all goes well. Grace is nice and quiet. But there's something up with her. A black car comes to ask about her. A man in the back hides behind a curtain, offering a reward for her. Wanted posters come up. Then a terrible thing happens to Grace, and the townspeople blame her, then turn on her and end up doing all kinds of horrible cruel things to her, and in the end she gets her (just?) revenge. The whole thing is filmed on a soundstage, with a black floor with chalk outlines of houses. Very little props. It's like a play. The movie is three hours long. Of course, it's not everyone's cup of tea, but I think it's pretty much amazing. I've watched it three times now, and it's never seemed like three hours to me.

A lot of people hate the movie, of course. "It's boring." "It's so unAmerican." "What's he trying to say?" I guess agree most with the theory that this is von Trier's take on how we treat immigrants. They work for us, stay out of the shadows, but if they step out of line, we try to squash them. It's pretty true, but it's not like we're the only country.

The second movie in this trilogy is Manderlay. Grace is played by Bryce Dallas Howard this time. After the disaster of Dogville, she and her father and his cronies are driving home. They happen upon a plantation where slavery still exists. Oh yeah, these films all take place in the 1930s. Grace takes it upon herself to set the slaves free. This was a really really controversial movie. It deals with race. Of course it is. And I really REALLY FUCKING WANT TO SEE IT. It opened up only to art house theatres, but of course it didn't come to any around here. Not even Ithaca. I was quite saddened. BUT... Yesterday I found out it's on DVD. It's OUT already. How the fuck did I miss that boat? I put it on my Netflix queue. I just need to watch and return the stuff I have.

Yesterday I also found out from Steve that Lucky McKee's The Woods is out too. WHAT THE SHIT. I need to watch some movies.

Aaaaaaaaand I've been rambling. So I'm just going to shut up.

Oh yeah, I want to do a whole story thing inspired by "Pirate Jenny". I don't know what yet. "Pirate Jenny" meets John Waters. That would be interesting. A play, and have it in the Brechtian style. Ugh, I'm so gay.

I've decided to just post the lyrics to "Pirate Jenny" just for the sake of completeness.

Marc Blitzstein's translation of "Pirate Jenny" by Bertrolt Brecht and Kurt Weill

1
You people can watch while I'm scrubbing these floors
And I'm scrubbin' the floors while you're gawking
Maybe once ya tip me and it makes ya feel swell
In this crummy Southern town, in this crummy old hotel
But you'll never guess to who you're talkin'.
No. You couldn't ever guess to who you're talkin'.
Then one night there's a scream in the night
And you'll wonder who could that have been
And you see me kinda grinnin' while I'm scrubbin'
And you say, "What's she got to grin?"
I'll tell you.

There's a ship, the black freighter
with a skull on its masthead
will be coming in.

2
You gentlemen can say, "Hey gal, finish them floors!
Get upstairs! What's wrong with you! Earn your keep here!
You toss me your tips
and look out to the ships
But I'm counting your heads
as I'm making the beds
Cuz there's nobody gonna sleep here, honey
Nobody! Nobody!
Then one night there's a scream in the night
And you say, "Who's that kicking up a row?"
And ya see me kinda starin' out the winda
And you say, "What's she got to stare at now?"
I'll tell ya.

There's a ship, the black freighter
turns around in the harbor
shootin' guns from her bow

3
Now you gentlemen can wipe that smile off your face
'Cause every building in town is a flat one
This whole frickin' place will be down to the ground
Only this cheap hotel standing up safe and sound
And you yell, "Why do they spare that one?"
Yes, that's what you say.
"Why do they spare that one?"
All the night through, through the noise and to-do
You wonder who is that person that lives up there?
And you see me stepping out in the morning
Looking nice with a ribbon in my hair.

And the ship, the black freighter
runs a flag up its masthead
and a cheer rings the air

4
By noontime the dock is a-swarmin' with men
comin' out from the ghostly freighter
They move in the shadows where no one can see
And they're chainin' up people and they're bringin' em to me
askin' me, "Kill them NOW, or LATER?"
Askin' ME! "Kill them now, or later?"
Noon by the clock
and so still by the dock
You can hear a foghorn miles away
And in that quiet of death
I'll say, "Right now.
Right now!"
Then they'll pile up the bodies
And I'll say,
"That'll learn ya!"

And the ship, the black freighter
disappears out to sea
And
On
It
Is
Me

After a couple weeks of trying, failing, and yarn-tearing, I've finally mastered the knit stitch.



Woot.

Forty rows and still going. Seeing as all I know to do is the knit stictch, I'm guessing I'll keep going until I run out of yarn and then bind it off into a scarf. Go me.

I'm hopped up on tea. Yes, I realize that this is a rather gay statement. But I'm tired and don't give a shit. It just took me six times to type "shit." I just did it again. I keep wanting to type "shot".

Oh, but what a mood I'm in. Earlier my glasses broke, andI shall have them fixed at Wal Mart tomorrow. I went to bed early and read for about half an hour. My eyes felt tired, so I turned off the light and layed down and closed my eyes, but twenty minutes later, here I am, bitching. I blame it on the tea. Lipton. That caffeine. I've been on this major tea kick this week. I love the stuff. It's pretty much all I've been drinking. Big mistake to drink before bed. And now I've got some DEcaffeinated Sweet Dreams tea. It should bring me down and make me sleepy, if the monitor burning into my naked eyes doesn't do it first.

BUT I am in SUCH a mood to write. I fished some plans for this screenplay from a year or so ago out and I hope to maybe start working on it soon.

I had a Piccarillos eggplant sandwich for supper. Amazing. On the way there, I saw a cluster of those Holy Roller sign-waving people gathered in the mini-park across the street from Piccarillos and Hunters. The ones who always picket on the four corners outside of Wegmans, preaching about God and Jesus (Jayzuz), and how the world is going to hell in a not-so-neatly-wrapped handbasket, etc. etc. They were gathered in a circle. It looked like they were getting a pep talk before heading off into the great big ol' world to keep fighting the good fight againt sinners and Sodomites. However, one of the corners was already occupied. A small cluster of people. One person waving the Stars and Stripes. The other, in a pair of fairy wings, waving a ROYGBIV Gay Pride flag. I instantly loved them. There must be a Gay Pride place or group in Auburn. I want to join! Maybe I'm just tired now. Maybe I was just really hungry at the time (haha... "Someone's HUNGRY!"). I just wanted to help and join the whole gay rights cause. Watching that steaming, festering dog turd of a film adaptation of the amazing graphic novel V For Vendetta, the best part was the whole scene with Valerie's letter. It brought tears to my eyes. The one line, "Why do they hate us" resonated so much. All the shit people do. I never was big on movements, but coming home, with my green hair, and some fucking redneck driving by and yelling "NICE HAIR, FAGGOT" really incensed me to do something. It doesn't really make any sense. I've never had any outright homophobia or hatred directed toward me, myself, but I just feel fed up with ignorance and such. Coming to know about the Phelpses didn't help either. Fuck them. In the ass. Ugh. I'm all tired and self-righteous. I need to go write.

Watching the Science of Sleep trailer. Looks a bit like Eternal Sunshine, but I don't care. Looks all quirky and lovely. I want to see it. I just have this thing for unconventional love stories. Awwwbigsigh.

Want to see Sweeney Todd too. Gah. Tickets are going, going, going.

Oh, yeah. Today, I was at Marten's, with my father, getting fresh corn and zucchini and stuff, and as I was getting corn, a vehicle drove by, and this loud voice blared, yelling, "NICE HAIR, FAGGOT!" Lovely. I go all the way out to Idaho, and I never get any overly hateful comments about my hair, I'm home for less than a week, and, hello homophobic ignorance. I hate to say it, but it made me feel shitty. More shitty at their intolerance and the fact that they probably wouldn't have said anything if they were just walking by me instead of driving by. I fucking hate that I have to live surrounded by these types of people, that I have to feel crappy because of who I am. Fuck them. I need NYC.

I really need to put the finishing touches on my journal I kept during the trip. I didn't document that Saturday, when I went to the redneck reception. These people were all sorts of proud of being redneck. Nothing against rednecks, but the image I see in the media is of two-stepping, cowboy-hat-wearing, truck-driving, drunken wife-beaters. Hell yeah at pride for that. But I'm sure they wouldn't be too keen on gay pride, although I'm sure I'm a lot more able to hold my tongue.

There was one guy who was wasted and all over Nettie. She told him off, and he'd come over me, putting his arms on my shoulders and talking quietly about her. It was disgusting. I was beyond uncomfortable, but didn't say anything. I've been around enough drunks to know that some of them can be set off by the slightest hint of sarcasm. Reminded me of Burns and JR and others I've witnessed beating the shit out of the women they "love." I had this awful twisting in my stomach all night. I hate that I have to feel like that, but you never know what alcohol is going to do.

I used to be anti-booze. Not straight-edge, just didn't like alcohol and didn't see any point in it besides to make you a fucking blubbering idiot. Now I just realize I'm anti-idiots who can't handle their alcohol and end up beating the shit out of loved ones or driving and killing others. Just the other day this guy drove drunk and crashed, sending his four year old daughter flying out of the windshield. I have no sympathy for him. Ugh. End rant.

So, on a good note, I have a new dog. This couple at the Redneck reception breeds Jack Russel Terriers, and Mom bought a puppy. He had a spiked collar, and when Mom told me to name him, I tried to think of punk-ish artists. Baudelaire came to mind. Didn't fit. Then I went from JACK Russel Terrier to JACK to.... JACKson Pollock. He was kind of a punk in his day, so I named him Jackson Pollock, and Mom likes Jack Nicholson, so his full name is Jackson Nicholson Pollock. I hate people who give their dogs full names (hi, Star Jones), but oh well.












Gah. I'm like one of those annoying parents who shove pictures of their baby in everyone's faces. To a single gay male, a puppy is like a baby. Quelle pathetic.

I'm off. To the great USofA. I said good-bye to dad. I felt like shit. I don't really want to go so much. Oh well. I'll write.

I have so much packing to do. All my clothes. Everything else. Blah.

So tired. I haven't been to sleep yet. Tried to finish my script for submission. Guess what I didn't finish? I put it on a disc to finish at Uncle Harold's.


FUCK.

I'm going to miss Dad. And Nikki. And Sandi. And all the rest. Like there are soooooo many more to miss.

A month seems like a really long time all of a sudden. And I have this pain in the pit of my gut.

This is pretty gross and dirty and of a HIGHLY personal nature, but fuck you. This is my journal. So, if you don't want to read about anything fucked up and involving bodily fluids... Don't read on...








































So anyway. Earlier, I was tired and couldn't fall asleep, so I decided to do what I usually do to fall. Masturbate.





So..... I masturbated.





And I was tired and didn't want to get a tissue, so I just let it go in my hand.




And then I must have nodded off. With the mess in my hand.


And then I woke up, and it was gone. Only it wasn't. It was like my hand absorbed it. Like a...YES. Like a LOTION. My hand was all smooth and supple. And a bit sticky. Obviously I washed my hands. Many times over. But still.... So soft. Like a baby's bottom. I've never touched a baby's bottom, but I hear good things.







I smell a new innovation in lotion design.

Ew.

So, I decided to go through and deleteall my old mail from my old wandj name. I had 9000-and something. Deleting bulk mail took it down to 7000-and something. Now I'm down to 6289.

I've come across all the Topica things from Art and Trash. Hmm. Nostalgia.


And Amy(Greene, not my sister)'s response to an email I sent her. She was a sort-of-friend. More of a friend of Randy and some other people I don't remember. Anyway, she had borrowed some of my underground horror books (Ed Lee!) and then after a falling out with some mutual friends, moved. I was pissed, since she had had my books forever, and I never got them back, and sent her a semi-harsh email. I didn't think she ever responded, but I found it. I should read it. Maybe when I'm done with the rest of everything.

So I got my grades today...

Issues in Art: On Location         A

Introduction to Sociology          A

World Literature II                   A

Alcohol                                    A

CPR-Basic Support                  A

Honors Seminar II                    A

Total Cumulative Grade: 3.567


I can understand the A's in Alcohol and CPR. You'd have to be an idiot to fail those. We didn't do much in Sociology, and the tests were take-home, so there's that. I still can't believe I did good on the NYC trip. And Honors, I can't believe Nelson liked my writing.


And about World Lit...

How in the name of FUCK did I get an A in there? Okay, I did good on my two papers. But I missed one assignment, didn't do extra credit, bombed the mid-term, don't know what I got on the final, but I'm pretty certain I bombed a significant portion of it.

I'm kind of (hella) confused.


Well, my average went up, so now I'm Magna Cum Laude. Go me.

It's been a while. And... not so much has happened.

Margaret Cho was great, Mr. Lurker.

Have a crush. Blah. Sad and pathetic and etc., I know.

Inner turmoil with my sexuality.

Back to writing.

Graduating Sunday.

Professor Nelson pulled me aside in class to tell me that he nominated me for the Honors Scholarship. And I won. All because he likes my writing. I don't know what I said or did, but I was pretty much in awe the rest of the day. I decided I should go to graduation. Ordered my cap and gown.

Told mom, and she said something along the lines of how she hopes I know how great an honor it is that Nelson nominated me (He's pretty high up in the English department, if not the head...). Gah. She's so...whatever the word its. I'm tired. Blah. Sill kind of struck with.

Can't decide if I should stay at home and get a job or go on this big trip next month. Trip, probably. Only thing is, I'll feel like shit since Dad couldn't get the time off (actually, he didn't even bother to see if he could), and he's going to be in the house, alone, for a month.

I really really want to dye my hair again. Green. Like Baudelaire. I'm really going to miss World Lit and Valdina and other things. Wahhhh.

Rewriting a script that got wiped off my computer after abut 90 pages in. Yeah. My life rules.

And I've decided what song I want playing at my funeral. Not that I plan on needing a funeral anytime soon, if I get my lard back to the Y.

I was meant for the stage,
I was meant for the curtain.
I was meant to tread these boards,
Of this much I am certain.

I was meant for the crowd,
I was meant for the shouting.
I was meant to raise these hands
With quiet all about me.
Oh, Oh.

Mother, please be proud.
Father, be forgiving.
Even though you told me
'Son, you'll never make a living.'
Oh, oh.

From the floorboards to the flies,
Here I was fated to reside.
And as I take my final bow,
Was there ever any doubt?
And as the spotlights fade away,
And you're escorted through the foyer,
You will resume your callow ways,
But I was meant for the stage.

The heavens at my birth
Intended me for stardom,
Rays of light shone down on me
And all my sins were pardoned.

I was meant for applause.
I was meant for derision.
Nothing short of fate itself
Has affected my decision.
Oh, oh.

And from the floorboards to the flies,
Here I was fated to reside.
And as I take my final bow,
Was there ever any doubt?
And as the spotlights fade away,
And you're escorted through the foyer,
You will resume your callow ways,
But I was meant for the stage.

Today was a pretty good day. Many things learned. It was so good and I'm so cool, I'm going to be totally cool and give you the blow-by-blow.....

World Lit. Finished up Baudelaire (Valdina made comment about Baudelaire dying his hair green, made a comment about how I should have done it for today, everyone looked, HAHAHAHAHAHAHHAHHAHAHAHHHHHHHHHAAAA). I'm going to miss her...uh...sultry voice reciting such hot stuff.

Was going to get a haircut, decided to wait until Saturday. Plan for going to mall with Nikki and Sandi. We hang out for a bit, then head out.

Walk around mall, go into Asian store. I got myself some pretty nifty chopsticks, (OH SHIT I LEFT THEM IN SANDI'S CAR), and now I can be a COOL fat kid and whip them out at China Buffets 'round the world and tell them no need to supply their weak little wooden sticks. I have my own, thank you sir.

Leaving the mall, I spot a Hooters, and make a (sarcastic) comment about how we should go there. I am taken seriously and it's considered such a good idea that Sandi thinks she can pull into the parking lot, when she's three lanes away. A near accident. We go to a bank, get money, and go back to Hooters. Slightly ditzy waitress. Nikki has the hots for her. Realizes she's a lesbian. BAM. Epiphany. Wow. Continues checking out waitresses. Waitress says she's "tired" and we get a new waitress, who's kind of a bitch. We leave.

Back at Sandi's my lack of getting a haircut is mentioned. While doing up Nikki's hair and putting in her chopsticks, Sandi says she'll do my hair. I say, "Okay. Wait. No. Not okay. Well...okay." On and on and on. I decided to give in. A few snips and a close call with some scissors later, I have a nice new haircut. I like it. A lot. I say it many times throughout the night. We head out to go....[drumroll]....BOWLING.

(holy new haircut)

We bowl. I lose. Badly. I get a 45 or something. Nikki and Sandi don't do all that much better. We realize we don't have any more money and decide to leave. I go to the bathroom. Go into stall. Pee. Flush. Open door, hit something, assume it's a human, say (since I'm a considerate human being), "Sorry." I see it's just a sink. Some really COOL (note sarcasm) redneck-ish guy says, "Oh, I think ya bruised tha sink thar. Heh heh." I say, "I think it'll be okay." I go to wash my hand. No knobs on the sink. The really funny guy turns off his water, which means you're done with the sink usually, and I turn the knobs and start washing my hands just as the funny guy pumps soap onto his hands. "Oh, wanna share ma sink, do ya?" he asks. "I sure do, sir," I reply. I leave. I make a big deal. No one else thinks it's a big thing. We leave.

We decide to go to Denny's. Stop at Sandi's so she can take her own car and Nikki can take her own car. We go to Denny's. Nikki tells Gaby she's a lesbian. Discussion follows. We wait to get waited on. I share the outline of my new short screenplay (wow I'm really cool). Nikki shows us how to play Texas Hold 'Em. We draw and wait. Draw and wait. Ever since Nikki got fired by that bitch (forget her name), it's been shitty going to Denny's. The Bitch is the manager. We never get waited on. No one asks what we want to drink. Fuckers. We leave.

So I got dropped off and now I'm hear, and now I'm done.

So I have the whole 10 page paper due tomorrow. Haven't started it yet. I did write a 131 page script instead, though. Meh. I work better under pressure.
What does your handwriting say about YOU?

The results of your analysis say:

You plan ahead, and are interested in beauty, design, outward appearance, and symmetry.
You are a person who thinks before acting, intelligent and thorough.
You are negative, fearful, resistant, doubtful, and/or selfish.
You are not very reserved, impatient, self-confident and fond of action.
You enjoy life in your own way and do not depend on the opinions of others.
Holy CRAP. Guess what I got today. Mhm. And I found the site of the people who's sponsoring it. http://www.cnypride.org/ Good cause.

So, I looked on Ticketmaster re: Margaret Cho. The show is the 20th of April.

So then I looked at the calendar thing on CCC to see when Spring Break was, because I'm pretty sure that's when the trip to NYC is.

Spring and Easter break: April 6-16.

Margaret Cho: April 20.

Holy crap.

Must go.

OMG.

OMG.

OMG.

Margaret Cho.

She's coming.

Here.

To the Landmark Theatre.

I must go.

Tickets go on sale tomorrow.

Must. Go.

MUST.

More drama with Mom and her money issues. She's depressed. Dad's depressed. Now I'm depressed. I need to get off of my fucking ass and find a job.

In other news, I finally got a hold of Randy.

I really fucking love it.

Life's going great. Fantastic. Then one little thing goes wrong. A bad day. It'll be over. Next day. Nope. It isn't. Then another thing. And another. And another fucking thing. Then more. And guess what. It's all shit. Again.

I really fucking love it.

I finally got my order from Rotton Cotton. And being the totally cool person I am, I'm going to share photos of them:


Battle Royale


 
front


back


DIVINE!


self explanatory


self explanatory


The Wicker Man (duh)

So Friday Sandi and I went to this poetry reading Jessa, a friend of a friend, had at Witches Brew, this little cafe I never knew existed. It was neat.

BUT...

NEXT WEEK. Saturday. This drag queen is having a show there. Apparently her last show. =(

Must. Go.

And we are going to kidnap Nikki if we have to so she can go.
So the auditions for the play are today (3:30) and tomorrow (2:00). I'm probably not going to bother, but it's a nice thought.

I finally got around to seeing The Producers. It wasn't too terrible. I really didn't like Matthew Broderick at first (he's definitely no Gene Wilder), but he grew on me. Nathan Lane is a GOD. His reactions and deliveries are perfect, if maybe a bit too over the top. Ulla Thurman can sing. And sing well, too! Will Farrell threatened to break loose a few times, but he was good as the Nazi playwright. Roger Bart and the guy who plays Roger de Bris (I forget his name and don't feel like looking it up) were good. Roger Bart plays a good flamboyant mo. Gary Whatshisface does drag well. They did cut my favorite part from the stage show, though. In the Springtime For Hitler sequence, de Bris as Hitler (a GAY HITLER ["Heil myself"] - how genius is that?!] defeats Stalin (by shoving him offstage) and FDR (by pushing him-by his wheelchair-offstage as well). It was missed, but ah well.

And, I've been meaning to recount an incident from last Sunday/Monday morning.

Nikki, Sandi, and I were out driving about the town after going to Wegmans for some Cliff Bars (holy shit I have a new addiction), and we were bored, so we decided it'd be fun to yell really offensive things out the windows as we passed people, houses, etc. Such things as "I need it bad," "Fuck me!", "Suck my cock," "Anyone want to rape me". You get the point. We passed through the bar district (whatever the street's called), and we shouted something just as a yuppie couple were getting into their vehicle. We kept going, then noticed a vehicle following us. We panicked, thinking it was the yuppie couple. I suggest we went down the Austeel service road to see if we were being followed (it comes out onto North Street-I think). We turned. We were followed. That's when I started freaking out, thinking some psycho was going to drive us off the road and/or kill/rape us. I tend to overreact to such things, but hey, I have an excuse. Anyway, as we came out onto North street, the vehicle turned out to be a cop car as its lights lit up. We got pulled over. MY FIRST EXPERIENCE OF BEING PULLED OVER. And the cop was a dick too. Apparently, Nikki wasn't driving to terribly well, sliding all over the road. At least we weren't pulled over for screaming obscenities into the still of the night.

Oh, and I tried cigarettes for the first time. Didn't like it at all. I can't see why someone would want to keep experiencing that. My tolerance for smokers has dropped even lower. I just want to throttle them sometimes. GAH!

I just remembered. Sandi was supposed to call me. That whore.
So, I found a site thing that lets you create and do things with LiveJournal. Obviously, mine sucks. Anyone know of any other sites?

...that you're falling, losing all control. Hopeless. Helpless. Yadda, yadda.

Wow, that sounded gay.

Well, anyway, I recently got over that. I haven't been on the computer (gasp!) for a few days. The thing crashed or something. Couldn't get on. Had to delete the entire C Drive. So, everything I've written/been writing for the past year and a half. Gone. All my photos. All my music. Gone. I was pretty fucking depressed. This on top of my mother being out of work since about Christmas time (my dad just getting back from being sick), my financial problems, blah blah blah. I was feeling pretty low. Then the whole computer thing. It sounds really fucking lame, but it felt like losing children. All these people (characters) I've created. Loved, hated, wanted to finish their stories. Notes I've made. Outlines. The few things I finished. Some I started. Gone. All gone. And yes, I realize in the whole grand scheme of things, this is all pretty irrelevant.

Well, I've pretty much come to grips with all that. I'd printed out some of my outlines, so that's not all lost. I just need to find them. I still have my Photobucket account with all my photos (duh) I've uploaded there.

This has all been somewhat cathartic. I think I'll redo my MySpace now. I've also really, really, really been having the urge to paint. I've been watching Frida for my seminar class (love the movie) and I was watching Basquiat a week or so ago. Damn people being inspiring.

So....HOLY SHIT.

I got the mail, and in the mail was a letter from CCC. It was the paperwork for the NYC trip. Reading over everything made it all that more real.

Can't wait.

So the other night I woke up at about 1 in the morning and couldn't fall asleep, so I watched The Royal Tenenbaums. It's now officially one of my favorite movies. Wes Anderson is a god at editing and selecting songs for soundtracks (so are Tarantino and Cameron Crowe). The prologue, set to the the orchestral version of "Hey Jude" by Mark Mothersbough, with the climax of Richie letting Mordecai soar over the city as the song crescendos to the auditory orgasm of the "na na na na na na na Hey Juuuuuuuuuuude"s (I'm a complete sucker for songs with "na na na"s in them. Clapping too), it gives me shivers every time. Plus the use of Nico and The Velvet Underground. I must have been really tired, but I was crying at the end. Fuck you, I was tired and yawning, and when I yawn, my eyes tear up and...yeah...

Speaking of auditory orgasms and Beatles songs, I cannot wait for this new movie by Julie Taymor. A musical set in the 60's, with Beatles songs. Taymor is such an amazing creative mind (Lion King stage production, Titus, Frida), and I can't wait for this to come out. It had better come to Auburn. Or Ithaca.

After The Royal Tenenbaums, Harold and Maude was on. Watched some of that. Probably one of the greatest love stories EVER. Speaking of love stories, I've been working on the one I wrote about before, but all I've really managed to do is convert it from third person to first person. Go me. It's about an on-again, off-again prostitute with schizophrenia and a pretty bad drug habit falling in love with a guy, and they go off on a road trip to visit an old friend and the guy's family. I'm not sure where I'm going with it. Hopefully I'll figure it out.

I'm going to be really cool and make a list of my top ten favorite movies.

Dogville
The Royal Tenenbaums
The Cook, the Thief, His Wife, and Her Lover
The Graduate
Female Trouble
Kill Bill (both volumes as one)
Rosemary's Baby

Meh. I could only come up with seven I really truly love.

I bought Pucnh Drunk Love at BJ's for 9.99. 9 fucking .99. I love BJ's [insert imature double entendre giggle here, that means you, Nikki]. I should go watch it.

And I also ordered some shirts from RottonCotton.

A Wicker Man one. A Battle Royale one. Camp Crystal Lake. Divine. "Everytime You Masturbate, God Kills a Kitten." "P.E.T.A. : People For the Eating of Tasty Animals." I'm not proud of those last two. Can't wait for them to come innnnnnn.

And tomorrow (later this morning) is the Y to try to get rid of some of my girth.

I'm such a softie.

I just remembered the whole story about Toga, the penguin, from back in December. And I thought, wow, he (or she?) is probably dead now. And that made me really fucking depressed. I'm not sure why. I still am. Fuck. I need to set my priorities in order.

So, I just called CCC and dropped Script Analysis. I really wanted to take it, but oh well. Now I can go to the Y 3 days a week instead of 2.

I tried to do the thing with AIM where you set up to have messages sent to your mobile, but it didn't work. Dammit. Well, it's not like I get so many messages on AIM, but JUST IN CASE.

And I've had this song stuck in my head all day, so I'm going to be really cool and post the lyrics.

So last night was pretty much great. And I actually got to finally use my camera. That was pretty friggin' exciting, I must say.

I've actually been writing. A love story. Boy (sex-addicted cutter) meets Girl (drug-addict former prostitute with Schizophrenia), and go on many wild adventures (eventually joining with tranny friend of Girl), and I'm not sure what's going to happen to them. Nothing good, most likely. And lots of sex. Yah. Lots of sex.

And I found these plans for a screenplay from my first semester. I might write it for my Script Analysis class, but it's kind of twisted, so I'm not sure. I keep forgetting that a lot of people don't have the same kind of humor I have (sigh).

Speaking of that class, I got an email yesterday from someone from CCC, in regards to my schedule, so I called today. There's a prerequisite I have to take. I told her how I've been over this with Wolstenholme, that I got verbal consent from Prof. Keeler, and yadda yadda yadda. So I have to get some sort of written consent, then bring it to the Registrar's office. I should get on that.

So yesterday and today were good. Amy and Donnie left yesterday. We (Mom and I) went out to lunch with them to see them off. Earlier I pretty much forced Dad to watch Dogville, since we have have HAVE to go see Manderlay in February (if it comes to Ithaca, and it had better), and I want someone I know to have seen it for reasons I'm not sure of.

Today we just sat around and watched some episodes of Deadwood and Lost. I think I got him onto Lost.

And I made this pretty amazing fucking dinner. I took the pork loin from a couple nights ago, heated the congealed juice, added water, and made rice in it. As that cooked, I chopped up the pork loin and some onion and celery. When the rice was done, I sauteed the onions and celery, then added the meat and some leftover peas, heated them up, added the rice, threw in some soy sauce and garlic powder, then a couple eggs, and it was done and, too my amazement, fucking good. Mhm.

It's kind of sad I just made a blog about what I ate for dinner.

Today Amy and Donnie are back, so we're going to see them.

Since Dad is so sick and can't move, I had to help him put his socks on. He's lost so much weight from just lying on the sofa. His foot that doesn't have the cellulitis scared me. It's so thin and pale. Like an old man's foot. Then it hit me. I felt slapped in the face. My father is old. He turns sixty this month.

Where have I been?

So my grades came today. They are as follows:

  • Abnormal Psychology :: C+
  • Computer Literacy ::::::::: A
  • World Literature I :::::::::: C
  • Intro to Economics 1 :::: C
  • Western Civilization I :::: A

GPA ::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::: 3.453

Basically, I'm a lucky bastard. I'm still not sure how I went from an F to a C in World Lit. Gah dayum.

I will make such an awesome adult.

Last week my mom was taken out of work. My dad's cellulitis came back in his leg, and he's out of work now, too. They're both bedridden. So I've had to do pretty much everything around the house. I did the tree. Wrapped the presents. Bought the presents.

And today I had to make Christmas dinner. I'm still making it, but I'm taking a break. I thought I'd not enjoy doing this, but it's actually been fun, sad as that sounds. But I've got a little help from the Tassimo hot beverage thing I got my father. It came with coffee and tea pods. Good stuff.

And I've been using my camera a lot. I made this creepy short thing of one of my cats. Yeah, I'm pathetic, but oh well.

And I got this boxed set of old movies I must watch.

And dinner is fucking good, if I do say so myself.

So today we went to Best Buy to get my present.

If this was a person, I'd totally do it. Mhm.

So I saw Peter Jackson's King Kong. Pretty impressive, I must say. It takes the original film and just expands it. Jack Black is pretty damn good at being a maniacal...uh...maniac. Adrien Brody was good, as usual. Same with Naomi Watts. I have to admit, I got a little misty-eyed at the ending. Plus I liked all the in-jokes, like the mention of "Fay," who's busy at work on a picture at RKO, and the crate containing the Sumatran Rat Monkey. I'm going to have to go watch Dead-Alive now.

Is it wrong that I found some of the Skull Island natives kind of...uh...hot?

Tomorrow we're going to do some more Christmas shopping and start with the Christmas cookies. Hurray. Called Village Camera Shop. Guess what. No camcorders. So we're going to Best Buy Wednesday. I think. It was supposed to be tomorrow, but I guess moved to Wednesday. Ah well.

In some of my recent posts I've mentioned how I've lost my cell phone. I've looked everywhere. My bookbag. My jackets. My old clothes. My room. I got to thinking the other day of where I last had it. It was last Thursday, at CCC, calling my mother. Then she got me. So I thought my phone either got lost at CCC, or in my mother's car. Well, today, I finally decided to go check her car. And when I got outside, I noticed something laying on the ground right outside the front passenger door.

My cell phone. Face down.

It's been out there a week now, in the snow, ice, cold, etc. And guess what. It still (kind of) works.

Anyway, I got King Kong from Netflix and watched it. It was pretty good, I must say. Now I'm ready to see Peter Jackson's version.

Yeah. I need a life.

Today was my last class. My last test. Except for my Intro to Moving Image take-home final. So, I'm done. Woo hoo.

Time to look for a job.

So this morning Mom mentioned the Village Camera Shop again, and asked if I'd be "terribly offended" if I knew what I was getting for Christmas, after I choose the camera I want. Of course I won't be. It's still kind of settling that I'm probably going to be getting one.

I seem to have lost my cell phone. I'm quite sad.

Last night was the final night of Intro to Moving Image. We watched one of my favorite movies I forgot about, Shallow Grave. I loooove watching it with people who have never seen it, and therefore don't know the little twists throughout. The reactions were priceless. Good stuff.

Yesterday was the last day for Western Civ, Abnormal Psych, and Economics. I think I did...eh...alright. I hope I did. I'm just a little bothered that the sense of relief I was expecting isn't coming.

This weekend I plan on re-reading everything for World Lit. I even plan on making little note cards to study from. Now, if this actually happens, I'll be surprised. I really, really want to pass this class, dammit.

So I haven't updated in a while, and Nikki told me to update, so I guess I will.

The semester's almost over, and I have a shitload of stuff I have to get done. I should be doing that instead of updating this thing. But I'm a sucker for procrastination.

I only have today, tomorrow, and tomorrow night, then I'm totally done. Except a test Monday. THEN I'm done. Then I can look for a job. Start going back to the Y. It'll all be good.

I really should be working on this goddamn paper. It's for World Lit, a class I don't even need, and I'm not sure why I'm stressing. That paper's 6-8 pages. Then a 5-page paper for Western Civ. I need to finish a ton of little assignments for the same class. Study for Abnormal Psych. Study for Economics. Do the last assignment for Economics. Blah, blah, blah, I know, but this is actually kind of therapeutic, so shut it.

Mom and Dad asked me what kind of camera I want last night (!!!!!). So I guess that means I'm actually going to get one. Wow. I'm beyond excited. I've only been wanting a camcorder ever since I knew what one was. And now I might be getting one. ;aksjflsgflsflsfdlhng We're going to go to the Village Camera shop. That's where Mom got her digital camera, and where Uncle Tom, the family's expert on this type of stuff, said we would get the best deal on the best digital camcorder.

And I keep kicking myself, harder each day, over NOT majoring in video at CCC. Stupidfuckingidiotmotherfucker. GAH. I didn't think it was what I wanted, and come to find out, it IS what I wanted. God damn it.

Ah well. I guess I'm going to start my World Lit paper. Blah.

So I've been reading the trio of John Waters scripts and listening to the Hairspray cast recording (saw it 2 weeks ago) and am in a total John Waters mood, so I started planning a John Waters-esque script. And... I have an outline. And a clear document on Word. I am SO about to start it. W00t.

So today I finally watched Palindromes. Probably Solondz's most disturbing, and that's saying a lot coming from the guy who made Happiness.

Last night I saw Derailed. I'd read the book and maybe since I knew what was coming, that could explain why I wasn't so thrilled with the movie. Two of my favorite actors, Clive Owen and Vincent Cassel, in a decent little thriller. And I honestly think Jennifer Aniston is a decent actress. And The RZA's not too shabby. So anyway, the movie was...eh...

And today I went to Ithaca to see Good Night, and Good Luck and A History of Violence. Good Luck, and Good Night was interesting. Almost all of the action took place inside the CBS studio. The black and white photography was beautiful. Great acting. The camerawork was really different, and I'm not sure if it was different in a good way or not.

A History of Violence was alright. I guess I was so hyped about it I feel a bit let down. It's hard to believe it's a David Cronenberg film. Pretty un-Cronenberg-esque. There were a few touches, such as unexpected moments of really, really dark humor.

Oooo. I went to the second-hand book shop and got a few books, one of which is John Waters' Trash Trio, the scripts to Pink Flamingos, Desperate Living(my favorite Waters film), and Flamingos Forever, the unfilmed sequel to Pink Flamingos. I got the script to Breaking the Waves as well.

Then, at this used-CD/DVD/record shop, I found Southern Comfort for $12. Yay for trannies.]

Now I have to go finish the first disc of 24's 3rd season and watch Palindromes (yay for Tod Solonz<3) so I can send them back to Netflix.
